heaviest_rainfall.status: 36.8mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 04 January 2025, marking an exceptional 37.2 hour precipitation event.  At times the rain was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, and resulted in 21.19mm of rain over 15.0 hours.  This is the highest rate recorded by our weather station.

longest_rain.status: The lengthiest precipitation event recorded spanned 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025, it was characterized by a peak rain intensity of 4.6mm per hour and a total rainfall of 36.8mm.

most_lightning.status: Since records began on 11 April 2025, the highest lightning strike count in one day is 23 on 07 September 2025.

nearest_lightning.status: The nearest lightning strike was on 13 May 2025, at a distance of 4.97 miles.

storm.status: No storms are expected.  The last storm was observed on 07 September 2025 and continued for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.7.

extreme.status: The maximum temperature difference seen is 26.7°C, observed on 29 April 2025 when the temperature fell to 0.4°C but also managed to reach 27.1°C on the same day.

heatwaves.status: There is no heatwaves at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 heatwavess, with an average of 1.9 per year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was recorded on 18 July 2025.  The total number of occurrences since 1973 number is only 62.

average.status: The current average wind direction is southerly (192°), which is about average.  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: 93.7 mph was the largest wind gust recorded on 13 October 2012.

run.status: To date, the maximum wind run recorded was 1754 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The largest wind speed ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 5.9°C) and outside temperature (down 5.1°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 5%).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in light levels (up 5602 lux) and cloud levels (up 561 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 5202 lux) and cloud levels (up 486 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 561.5m lower than yesterday, 24.7m higher than the past week, 485.9m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 928m to a maximum of 5160m, averaging 1972.8m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1948.1m and 2460m respectively.
cloud levels.summary: The clouds will be high, plenty of sunshine is expected.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should feel pleasantly mild. Outside; temperatures should feel nicely warm. Also, neither too dry nor too humid and little or no wind. A few light raindrops may fall, the clouds will be high, plenty of sunshine is expected, and bright intervals likely. Weather could become unsettled.
